intro: Rhodognaphalopsis pseudofaroensis, commonly known as the Tibetan sandwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in arid, sandy soils and is adapted to the extreme environmental conditions of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
